elements.content:
[[h3]]What is Artificial Intelligence?[[/]]
➔ It is an expansive field covering many disciplines ranging from Computer Vision to Machine Learning
➔ Aims to simulate part of human intelligence in computers
➔ It has applications in medicine, finance, hospitality, and many more
➔ Modern examples include Google Assistant, Self-driving cars, some player vs computer games, and more
[[h3]]Why is Python useful for AI?[[/]]
➔ Less Code
➔ Pre-built libraries
➔ Massive community support
➔ Easy to learn
➔ Ability to visualize
[[h3]]What is Machine Learning?[[/]]
➔ Subfield of AI
➔ Machines to learn some task without being explicitly programmed for that specific task
➔ One of the most popular fields of AI
➔ Deep Learning is a more complex subset of Machine Learning

[[h3]]The Process[[/]]
➔ [[b]]Models[[/]] are trained on data, and tested on data they have not seen yet to evaluate their effectiveness
➔ Models are the actual programs that do tasks in ML
➔ The type of model you use depends on the task
➔ Lot of testing and application is required to figure out the best method to use for a given problem

[[h3]]Methods of ML[[/]]
[[h3]]Supervised Learning[[/]]
➔ Labelled training data is fed into the algorithm
➔ The algorithm learns and develops a model for predicting future values
➔ The model is tested on unlabelled testing data that the model has never seen
➔ If successful, we can use this model to predict unknown labels

[[h3]]Types of Supervised Learning Algorithm[[/]]
➔ [[b]]Linear Regression[[/]]: line of best fit to predict future values
➔ [[b]]Logistic Regression[[/]]: Two classes fitted by logistic curve
➔ [[b]]Decision Tree[[/]]: Yes/No tree to make predictions
➔ [[b]]Neural Networks*[[/]]: Complex mathematical model made using nodes and weights for many purposes
➔ and many more
[[h3]]Unsupervised Learning[[/]]
➔ Unlabelled training data is fed into the algorithm
➔ The algorithm learns and finds a hidden pattern in the data
➔ Outputs the classified inputs
➔ Typically used to find hidden patterns in data invisible to humans
➔ Results are sometimes run through experts to make sure the pattern found actually exists

[[h3]]Applications of Unsupervised Learning[[/]]
➔ Categorize news articles automatically
➔ Recognize objects in images
➔ Medical Diagnosis
➔ Find anomalies in data
➔ Discover data trends for recommendation
